problems.title: Maximum Points You Can Obtain from Cards (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
There are several cards arranged in a row, and each card has an associated number of points.
In one step, you can take one card from the beginning or from the end of the row. You have to take exactly k cards.
Your score is the sum of the points of the cards you have taken.
Given the integer array cardPoints and the integer k, return the maximum score you can obtain.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and k.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the maximum score.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
7 3
1 2 3 4 5 6 1

Sample Output
12

Explanation: Take the three cards on the right: 1 + 6 + 5 = 12.
hintsList: Taking k cards from the ends is equivalent to leaving a subarray of size n-k in the middle.
Minimize the sum of the subarray of size n-k.
